result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Ayers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment, attend school full time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Cooperate with random testing as required by agent.   Complete AODA assessment and follow through with counseling, treatment and aftercare.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Must comply with the Sex Offender Registry and complete sex offender treatment.  Cooperate with other treatment and counseling as determined appropriate.  No contact with any person under the age of 18 years without the prior consent of the agent and minors' parents.  No contact with the victim or victim's family, directly or indirectly, in any way.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

records.addlTxt: 02-26-2016 Sentencing hearing.
Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system
does not plan to seek relief.

Defendant Michael E Ayers in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Michael E Ayers in custody.  Robert S Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel  950 compliance  PSI has been reviewed by the State.  No additions or corrections by the State.  PSI has been reviewed by the Defense.  No additions or corrections by the Defense.  State proceeds with it's sentencing argument and recommends prison.  Defense proceeds with it's sentencing agrument.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  

BTC:
Ct. 1-DRI
Ct. 2-10 years WPS: 5/5
Ct. 3-10 years WPS: 5/5 cons. to count 2
Ct. 4-3 years WPS: 1/2 cons. to count 2 and 3
Ct. 5-3 years WPS: 1/2 cons. to count 2, 3 and 4

Conditions:  
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a doctor
Rqandom UAs or breatalizers
AODA assessment, treatment and aftercare
Any counseling recommended by the agent
Must comply with the Sex Offender Registry
Must complete Sex Offender Treatment
No contact with any minors or anyone under the age of 18 years without the consent of the agent and parents
FT verifiable employment or employment and school equal to full time
No contact with the victim or the victims family, directly or indirectly, in any way.
Defendant must pay court costs, assessments and DNA surcharges 
Not eligible for CIP or Substances Abuse Program
DNA sample must be provided
FAW

Defendant Michael E Ayers in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Michael E Ayers in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with any minors.  No contact with the victim, L.J.R. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael E Ayers in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Michael E Ayers in custody.  Christopher Steerod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.
